maml:description.maml:para: Download from a remote server via SCP a file or directory.
Download from a remote server via SCP a file or directory.
FQDN or IP Address of host to establish a SSH connection.
SSH Credentials to use for connecting to a server. If a key file is used the password field is used for the Key pass phrase.
Auto add host key fingerprint to the list of trusted host/gingerprint pairs.
Connection timeout interval in seconds.
Path to the location where to download the item to.
Raise an exception if the fingerprint is not trusted for the host.
Do not check the remote host fingerprint.
OpenSSH format SSH private key file.
New name for the item on the destination path.
Do not show upload progress.
Timeout for execution of an operation.
Path to item on the remote host to download.
What type of Item you are getting from the remote host via SCP.
SSH TCP Port number to use for the SSH connection.
PowerShell Credential Object with the credentials for use to connect to proxy server if required.
Port to connect to on proxy server to route connection.
Proxy server name or IP Address to use for connection.
Type of Proxy being used (HTTP, Socks4 or Socks5).
Sets a timeout interval in seconds after which if no data has been received from the server, session will send a message through the encrypted channel to request a response from the server
Known Host IStore either from New-SSHMemoryKnownHost, Get-SSHJsonKnownHost or Get-SSHOpenSSHKnownHost.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Download in to the local path the dmesg file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-SCPItem -ComputerName 192.168.1.169 -Credential carlos -Path "/var/log/dmesg" -PathType File -Destination ./ -NewName dmesg_server_169

dev:remarks.maml:para: Download in to the local path the dmesg file and give it a different name.

maml:description.maml:para: Download a filefrom a SSH Server using SFTP.
Download a folder from a SSH server using SFTP against a current session.
Session Id number of an exiting SFTP Session.
Folder on the local machine where to download the file to.
Full path on of file to download on the remote host.
If file is already present locally overwrite it.
@{Text=}
SFTP Session Object of a currently connected session.
Folder on the local machine where to download the file to.
Full path on of file to download on the remote host.
If file is already present locally overwrite it.
@{Text=}
Session Id number of an exiting SFTP Session.
Full path on of file to download on the remote host.
Folder on the local machine where to download the file to.
@{Text=}
If file is already present locally overwrite it.
SFTP Session Object of a currently connected session.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Download from the current session path the bash_history file and save it locally.

maml:description.maml:para: Downloads via SFTP an item from a SSH server.
Downloads via SFTP an item from a SSH server. An Item can be a directory or a file.
Existing SFTPSession object.
Local path where to download item to.
Remote path of item to download.
Overrite item on the local host if it already pressent.
Do not follow symboliclinks if present in a directory.
Do not show upload progress.
Session Id of an existing SFTPSession.
Local path where to download item to.
Remote path of item to download.
Overrite item on the local host if it already pressent.
Do not follow symboliclinks if present in a directory.
Do not show upload progress.
Local path where to download item to.
Overrite item on the local host if it already pressent.
Do not show upload progress.
Remote path of item to download.
Existing SFTPSession object.
Session Id of an existing SFTPSession.
Do not follow symboliclinks if present in a directory.
SSH.SftpSession[] System.String[] System.String System.Management.Automation.SwitchParameter

dev:remarks.maml:para: Downloads the .ssh folder from the server to the current directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Get known hosts stored in a JSON file created by Posh-SSH. If a file is not specified it will default to $HOME\.poshssh\hosts.json. If the file specified is not present it will be created.
Get known hosts stored in a JSON file created by Posh-SSH. If a file is not specified it will default to $HOME\.poshssh\hosts.json. If the file specified is not present it will be created.
JSON known_hosts file. If none is specified %HOME%/.poshssh/hosts.json is used.
JSON known_hosts file. If none is specified %HOME%/.poshssh/hosts.json is used.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $jsontest = Get-SSHJsonKnowHost -LocalFile .\test.json PS C:\> $jsontest.SetKey("192.168.1.1","Router","12:f8:7e:78:61:b4:bf:e2:de:24:15:96:4e:d4:72:53") True PS C:\> $jsontest.GetAllKeys()
HostName HostKeyName Fingerprint -------- ----------- ----------- 192.168.1.1 Router 12:f8:7e:78:61:b4:bf:e2:de:24:15:96:4e:d4:72:53

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a JSON Kmnown Host Store object and using its methods add a new entry.

maml:description.maml:para: Get known_hosts stored in a OpenSSH file. If a file is not specified it will default to $HOME\.ssh\known_hosts. If the file specified is not present it will be created.
Get known_hosts stored in a OpenSSH file. If a file is not specified it will default to $HOME\.ssh\known_hosts. If the file specified is not present it will be created.
OpenSSH known_hosts file. If none is specified %HOME%/.ssh/known_hosts is used.
OpenSSH known_hosts file. If none is specified %HOME%/.ssh/known_hosts is used.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $SSHKnown = Get-SSHOpenSSHKnownHost PS C:\> $SSHKnown.GetAllKeys()
HostName HostKeyName Fingerprint -------- ----------- ----------- 192.168.1.165 ecdsa-sha2-nistp256 3c:bf:26:9f:d9:63:d7:48:b8:fc:7b:32:e8:f9:5a:b4

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get known hosts already stored by the Windows 10 OpenSSH client in the users home folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an SSH Session against a SSH Server

Creates an SFTP Session against a remote server. The command supports creating connection thru a Proxy and allows for authentication to the server using username and password. If a key file is specified the command will use the password in the credentials parameter as the paraphrase of the key.
FQDN or IP Address of host to establish a SFTP Session.
SSH Credentials to use for connecting to a server. If a key file is used the password field is used for the Key passphrase.
SSH TCP Port number to use for the SFTP connection.
Proxy server name or IP Address to use for connection.
Port to connect to on proxy server to route connection.
PowerShell Credential Object with the credentials for use to connect to proxy server if required.
Type of Proxy being used (HTTP, Socks4 or Socks5).
@{Text=}
@{Text=}
Keep Alive interval in seconds for a connection.
Automatically accepts a new SSH fingerprint for a host
Do not perform any host key validation of the host.
Throw a terminating error if the host key is not a trusted one.
OpenSSH format SSH private key file.
{{ Fill KnownHost Description }}
FQDN or IP Address of host to establish a SFTP Session.
SSH Credentials to use for connecting to a server. If a key file is used the password field is used for the Key passphrase.
SSH TCP Port number to use for the SFTP connection.
Proxy server name or IP Address to use for connection.
Port to connect to on proxy server to route connection.
PowerShell Credential Object with the credentials for use to connect to proxy server if required.
Type of Proxy being used (HTTP, Socks4 or Socks5).
@{Text=}
@{Text=}
Keep Alive interval in seconds for a connection.
Automatically accepts a new SSH fingerprint for a host
Do not perform any host key validation of the host.
Throw a terminating error if the host key is not a trusted one.
OpenSSH key in a string array to be used for authentication.
{{ Fill KnownHost Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new SFTP Session to a remote hosts using credentials.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new in-memory known host IStore for temporary use when creating new SSH and SFTP Sessions.
Creates a new in-memory known host IStore for temporary use when creating new SSH and SFTP Sessions.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $inmem = New-SSHMemoryKnownHost PS C:\> New-SSHTrustedHost -KnowHostStore $inmem -HostName 192.168.1.165 -FingerPrint 3c:bf:26:9f:d9:63:d7:48:b8:fc:7b:32:e8:f9:5a:b4 -Name Pi True PS C:\> $inmem.GetAllKeys()
HostName HostKeyName Fingerprint -------- ----------- ----------- 192.168.1.165 Pi 3c:bf:26:9f:d9:63:d7:48:b8:fc:7b:32:e8:f9:5a:b4

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create and in-memory known host store and add a entry to it.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an SSH Session against a SSH Server. By default it will store known host fingerprints in $HOME\.poshss\hosts.json.

Creates an SSH Session against a remote server. The command supports creating connection thru a Proxy and allows for authentication to the server using username and password. If a key file is specified the command will use the password in the credentials parameter as the paraphrase of the key.
FQDN or IP Address of host to establish a SSH Session.
SSH Credentials to use for connecting to a server. If a key file is used the password field is used for the Key pass phrase.
SSH TCP Port number to use for the SSH connection.
Proxy server name or IP Address to use for connection.
Port to connect to on proxy server to route connection.
PowerShell Credential Object with the credentials for use to connect to proxy server if required.
Type of Proxy being used (HTTP, Socks4 or Socks5).
Connection timeout interval in seconds.
Operation timeout interval in seconds.
Keep Alive interval in seconds for a connection.
Automatically accepts a new SSH fingerprint for a host
Do not perform any host key validation of the host.
Throw a terminating error if the host key is not a trusted one.
OpenSSH format SSH private key file.
Known Host IStore either from New-SSHMemoryKnownHost, Get-SSHJsonKnownHost or Get-SSHOpenSSHKnownHost.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-SCPItem -ComputerName 192.168.1.169 -Credential carlos -Path .\testcode -Destination /tmp -Verbose VERBOSE: Using SSH Username and Password authentication for connection. VERBOSE: Fingerprint for 192.168.1.169: 5a:a3:85:c6:63:83:6b:6c:2a:8f:9b:44:20:70:eb:7c VERBOSE: Fingerprint matched trusted fingerprint for host 192.168.1.169 VERBOSE: Connection successful VERBOSE: Uploading: C:\testcode VERBOSE: Destination: /tmp/testcode

dev:remarks.maml:para: Uploade a directory to the target folder.
